column1: There are many different aspects to Komodo. To help get you familiar with the ecosystem

column1: When was the Komodo project started?""
*The foundational idea for Komodo Platform was born on February 21
column3: when James ‘jl777’ Lee published his Declaration of Independence:

column1: We the asset holders hereby declare our independence from any single blockchain.
An open and jointly developed specification on cross-chain atomic asset transfers will be developed. Any current or future blockchain is invited to join.
Each blockchain will need to not only promise protections for asset holder interests
column2: they need to live up to them. Otherwise
column3: all the assets will simply move to blockchains that do.….

column1: This is an interop standards effort and it needs to be blockchain agnostic and asset centric.""

column2: Komodo held its initial coin offering to make this remarkable vision a reality.*";"";"";

column1: *Yes. Komodo held an ICO that lasted just over one month
column2: from Oct 15 to Nov 20 of 2016. KMD was sold a rate of 0.00012908222 BTC per coin

column1: One-hundred million KMD coins were issued
column2: with 70% of the KMD swapped to BTCD holders
column4: and the remaining 10% held as working capital for Komodo’s development and marketing.

column1: Over the course of the ICO
column2: Komodo Platform raised a total of 2
column3: 639 BTC. The closing price of BTC on November 20
column5: we see that Komodo raised a total of $1

column1: The BTC raised in the ICO is used almost exclusively to pay BTC transaction fees necessary for the Delayed Proof of Work security mechanism to function.*

column2: Komodo’s technology provides the tools that developers
column4: and enterprise businesses need to create a customized blockchain to host an application
column6: or other blockhain-based solution. All of Komodo’s development is driven by the principles of composability.

column1: Composability is a design principle focused on providing a wide array of components
column2: which can be activated as needed and used in different configurations to meet the unique demands of a specific use case. Composable systems place emphasis on enabling fully modular
column3: rapidly-deployable solutions that are powered by a fluid set of resources to support growth.

column1: Komodo has achieved the requirements of composability with the Antara Framework
column2: a flexible framework for end-to-end blockchain development.

column1: With the principle of composability in mind
column2: Komodo is working towards its mission of accelerating global blockchain adoption through a flexible multi-chain architecture
column4: and a business-friendly ecosystem that allows developers
column6: and enterprise alike to prosper with customized blockchain solutions.*";"";"";

column1: *Komodo is distinct from other blockchains in several ways.

column2: the Komodo Platform is built atop a multi-chain architecture that can support an unlimited number of independent Smart Chains.

column1: Ordinary smart contract platforms are but a single blockchain with one network for all third-party projects to share. This single
column2: shared blockchain architecture is a recipe for crippling congestion

column1: Komodo is unique because of its multi-chain architecture
column2: which gives every project their very own dedicated blockchain with independent infrastructure. If one chain isn’t providing adequate performance
column3: additional chains can be added to scale out and increase performance linearly.

column2: Komodo is distinct from other multi-chain platforms in that Komodo offers complete autonomy. Some multi-chain interoperability projects impose a rental model
column3: in which projects must continue to pay fees to maintain their application-specific blockchain. Other multi-chain projects force projects to pay high fees in the platform’s native coin for essential services.

column1: While Komodo does offer platform services that are paid in KMD— Delayed Proof of Work (dPoW) Security and Platform Synchronizations— third-party projects can decide whether or not to use them.

column2: a project that builds with Komodo can choose to make their Smart Chain Proof of Stake (PoS)
column3: which would eliminate many of the security vulnerabilities that new PoW networks face. Or
column4: a project that builds with Komodo could use dPoW’s open source code and establish their own network of notary nodes to receive Bitcoin-level security without paying fees in KMD.

column2: Komodo provides a level of independence that no other platform can offer.*";"";"";

column1: What is Komodo working on now?""
*Development at Komodo happens at breakneck speed so it can change on a week-to-week basis
column2: but here are a few things that the Komodo Team is currently focusing on:

column1: Constantly improving and adding coins to AtomicDEX
column2: the ecosystem’s native multi-coin wallet and mobile-ready atomic swap DEX combined into one

column1: Creating new features and customization options for Antara Smart Chains
Building up the Antara Module library in order to provide third-party projects with more performance boosting options.
Continuing to improve upon the Antara Smart Chain Composer
column2: an automated web application that lets users customize and launch a sovereign Smart Chain in minutes.

column1: Integrating more external blockchains to Komodo’s delayed Proof of Work (dPoW) security service network.
This is only a partial list but it includes most of the major developments currently taking place at Komodo Platform.*

What are the primary use cases of KMD?""
*KMD is the native currency in the Komodo ecosystem. It has a number of important uses.
- Those who hold 10 KMD or more can easily earn 5% active user rewards.
- KMD trading pairs get a 10% discount in trading fees on AtomicDEX mobile.
- KMD is also the most widely-traded coin on AtomicDEX
column2: so KMD can act as a go-between for two other tokens that do not yet have a direct market between them.

column1: - KMD is the currency in which the Delayed Proof of Work Security and Platform Synchronizations services are paid.
- KMD holders are allowed to participate in Komodo’s annual Notary Node Election
column2: meaning that they have the ability to help choose who operates the Notary Nodes.*";"";"";
